properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Mother's Day Classic fun run & walk is taking place at Parramatta Park from 7am. Parramatta Park will be closed from 5am to 12pm midday. No parking will be available within the park during this time.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as attenddees travel to and from the event.

Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

webLinks.linkText: Mother's Day Classic Fun Run & Walk 2024

properties.publicTransport: Route 504 and 506 will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of participants will take part in 5km and 10km Mother's Day Classic fun run and walk events starting from 7am in The Domain. Participants will travel along sections of Macquarie St, College St then Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquarie's Rd to finish back in The Domain by approximately 11:30am.

ROAD CLOSURES

  • 5am to 12pm midday - Art Gallery Rd/Mrs Macquarie's Rd from Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd. Access to Hospital Rd is via Shakespeare Pl only in both directions.
  • 6am to 10am - Macquarie St between St James Rd and Hunter St, College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd and sections of St James Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary's Rd and Yurong Pkwy will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 5am to 10am on sections of Macquarie St, Hunter St, College St, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary's Rd and St James Rd. Clearways will also be in effect on sections of Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd from 5am to 12pm midday.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Mother's Day is traditionally one of the busiest days on the roads. Wherever you are travelling, expect it to take longer than usual and factor in extra travel time.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

FROM 5AM TO 10AM

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Mrs Macquarie's Road from Art Gallery Road
  • Hospital Road* between Prince Albert Road and Shakespeare Place

FROM 6AM TO 10AM

Notes:

* Access to Hospital Road will be via Shakespeare Place only, in both directions. Vehicle access is limited to vehicles requiring access to Sydney Hospital, emergency services, contracted tow trucks and accredited / authorised event vehicles.

NB: Hospital Road will be heavily used by pedestrians before/during/after the event, crossing in both directions between The Domain and the start/finish line area.

^Managed Local Access into St Mary's Road to Cathedral Street and the Domain car park. St Mary's Rd will be closed at Sir John Young Cres when the Domain car park is full.

Banner Ave (Kidman Way) will be closed in both directions between Jondaryan ve and Ulong St for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists are advised to take extra caution in the area as there is an expected increase in pedestrian activity.
properties.diversions: A detour will be in place via Jondaryan Ave, Yambil St and Ulong St.

properties.publicTransport: ﻿Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Niall Horan concert will be taking place at Qudos Bank Arena on Wednesday 1 May from 7:30pm to 10:15pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct during the already busy evening peak.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Tickets to Rabbitohs match include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Panthers at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 5:25pm. NRL kick-off at 7:50pm, full time around 9:35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd during the already busy evening peak.

  • CAR PARKS: Pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Warriors at McDonald Jones Stadium. Preliminary game from 11:30am. NRL kick-off from 2pm, finish around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Griffiths Road

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, and event shuttle buses will run from Caringbah, Cronulla and Woolooware train stations before and after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Dragons at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 4:05pm, full-time approx 6pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

roads.mainStreet: Captain Cook Drive

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Wests Tigers at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off from 12.40pm. NRL kick-off at 3pm, full time around 4:45pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to the match while other events take place in the precinct. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the events unless sold out prior.

Monster Truck Mania at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday 4 and Sunday 5 May. Shows start 1pm and finish at 3.40pm daily.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the events unless sold out prior.

properties.otherAdvice:
Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga film premiere at the State Theatre on Thursday 2 May from 6pm to 10pm.

Lane and footpath closures will be in place on Market St between Pitt St and George St for the event:

  • From 10am to 10pm, the southern footpath on Market St will be closed to pedestrians
  • From 4am until 1am (Fri 3 May), lanes 1 and 4 on Market St will be closed.

Motorist should expect traffic delays along Market St during the event, allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the theatre.

roads.mainStreet: Market Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip by public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Hawkesbury Cup Day will be held at Hawkesbury race Club in Clarendon on Saturday 4 May. The gates open at 10:30am.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Rd, The Northern Rd and Richmond Rd approaching the Precinct as families travel to the showground over the weekend.

Heavy traffic is expected in Clarendon and surrounding suburbs approaching the Race Club. Attendees travelling to the show are encouraged to catch trains instead to avoid delay.

roads.mainStreet: Racecourse Road

properties.publicTransport: On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm buses and light rail services will not run to Circular Quay. Buses will be relocated to stops at Martin Place and light rail services will run to and from Town Hall only. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.
properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 14th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 24 May to Saturday 15 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect each night. 

Key road closure timings:

Nightly:

  • 12pm midday - midnight: Cumberland St south of Essex St
  • 3pm - midnight: Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal.
  • Each weekend From 2pm Friday to 1am Monday, George St will close between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd for the Rocks markets.

Monday to Thursdays

  • 5pm – midnight: George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St from George St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. 

Fridays

  • 5pm – midnight: George St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. 
  • 6pm – midnight: roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets, and in Ultimo, Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm – midnight: westbound lanes Erskine St from Clarence St to Sussex St and southbound lanes Kent St from Margaret St to Erskine St.

Saturdays and Sunday (9 June) of the long weekend 

  • 5pm - 1am: sections of Grosvenor St, Bridge St,  George St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane, sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets north of Bridge St. Westbound lanes Erskine St from Clarence St to Sussex St and southbound lanes Kent St from Margaret St to Erskine St.
  • No access east/west across the city via Grosvenor/Bridge Streets.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd, and Thomas St from Quay St.
  • 7pm - 11pm: Wheat Rd from Harbour St at Darling Harbour

Saturday 8, Sunday 9 and Saturday 15 June only - 8pm - 10pm: In Milsons Point Olympic Drive/Broughton from Alfred St Sth to Fitzroy St.

Sundays and Monday 10 June (public holiday)    

  • 5pm – midnight: George St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. Roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets. Westbound lanes Erskine St from Clarence St to Sussex St and southbound lanes Kent St from Margaret St to Erskine St.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: in Ultimo, Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd, and Thomas St from Quay St.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the Sydney CBD in effect on weekends.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Bridge St, Grosvenor Street
roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Walsh Bay, Barangaroo, Darling Harbour

properties.otherAdvice:
The Greek and Macedonian Easter Procession will take place on Friday 3 May from 8pm to 10pm.

The procession will occupy Stewart, Harbour and Burelli Street.

Corrimal Street from Burelli Street to Stewart Street will be closed and a detour will be in place.
properties.diversions:
Motorists travelling southbound will be via Burelli Street, Kembla Street and Stewart Street.

Motorists travelling northbound will be via Stewart Street Kembla Street and Crown Street.

roads.mainStreet: Corrimal Street

properties.otherAdvice: Ironman 70.3 Port Macquarie will take place on Sunday 5 May from 4am to 6pm. Speed restrictions, road closures and detours will be in place from around 4am through to 8pm. Blackmans Point Interchange will be closed. Port Macquarie access via Port Macquarie Interchange (Oxley Highway). Delays are expected throughout Port Macquarie on the day with increased volume of pedestrians. Follow the direction of signage and traffic control. For local road closures and impacts visit: www.ironman.com/im703-port-macquarie
properties.diversions:
During the event hours of 4am to 6pm, northbound motorists wanting to access Telegraph Point will need to plan for additional travel time. To detour:

  • Travel 14km north of Blackmans Point Interchange, exit the M1 using Yarabee Road Exit
  • Turn right to Taree using the underpass
  • Right to Taree to access the M1 southbound, travel approximately 3km south
  • Use the Telegraph Point exit Haydons Wharf Road.

roads.mainStreet: Pacific Highway

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW interactive road closure and clearway map - Half Marathon

properties.otherAdvice:
Major road closures will be in place on Sunday morning between 4am and 11:30am in the Sydney CBD, The Rocks, Barangaroo and Pyrmont for the Runaway Sydney Half Marathon. 10km event starts from 6.25am followed by the Half Marathon at 6.50am. Events start from the Cahill Expressway at Bridge St/Macquarie St finishing at St Mary's Cathedral Square on College St.

Motorists are encouraged to avoid non-essential travel in the CBD and Pyrmont areas during the event as delays are expected. Diversions will be in place, follow detour signs and allow extra travel time.

Key road closures:

  • Sydney CBD - 2am to 2pm: Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd, College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd, St James Rd and Prince Albert Rd at Hyde Park (event finish line). From 12.30pm, Macquarie St will reopen southbound only from Hunter St to St James Rd/Elizabeth St.
  • Motorists can cross Macquarie St at Shakespeare Place & Bent St before 5.30am and after 11am. After 11am no access to or from Macquarie St. Access to the Eastern Distributor will be available via William St.
  • Sydney CBD - 4am to 11.30am: Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass, Macquarie St between Albert St and Bent St, Bridge St between Phillip St and Macquarie St, Conservatorium Rd and Kent St northbound from Margaret St to Argyle St.
  • Motorists travelling toward the Eastern Distributor or the eastern suburbs should use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel while the Cahill Expressway Overpass is closed.
  • Circular Quay - 4am to 9:30am: Bridge St from Phillip St to Young St, Bridge St eastbound from Pitt St to Phillip St, Phillip St (South of Bridge St) and Phillip Lane.
  • Pyrmont & King St Wharf - 5am to 9:30am: the Western Distributor from Pyrmont to the CBD including Fig St, Pyrmont St and Market St on-ramps and King St and Harris off-ramps will be closed. Sections of Union St, Murray St, Pyrmont St, Darling Drive and surrounding local roads, Sussex St from Napoleon St to King St and Erskine St between Shelley St and Kent St will also be closed.
  • Motorists travelling citybound on the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via the Bathurst St off-ramp to rejoin the Harbour Bridge, no direct access from the Anzac Bridge to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Motorists in Pyrmont travelling to the city, or the Harbour Bridge will be diverted via Harris St and local roads.
  • Pyrmont - 5am to 10am: Pirrama Rd from Harris St to Darling Island Rd, Bowman St, Refinery Drive, Harris St and surrounding local roads.
  • Pyrmont - 5am to 10:30am: Pirrama Rd between Darling Island Rd and Union St
  • Millers Point & Barangaroo - 5am to 11am: Hickson Rd/Sussex St from Napoleon St to the Overseas Passenger Terminal, Towns Pl, Dalgety Rd, Pottinger St, Windmill St and Watson Rd. Access to the Rocks is maintained via York St, Lang St, and Harrington St.
  • The Domain from 5am to 12pm: Hospital Rd, Art Gallery Rd, Mrs Macquaries Rd and St Marys Rd

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads throughout the Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Millers Point and Pyrmont between 12.01am and 2pm. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SYDNEY CBD

From 2AM to 2PM

  • College St between Prince Albert Rd and Park St
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Prince Albert Rd Northern Side
  • Macquarie St between St James Rd and Hunter St Northbound
  • Prince Albert between Macquarie St and St Marys Rd

From 2AM to 12:30PM

  • St James Rd from Macquarie St to Elizabeth St Westbound
  • Macquarie St from Hunter St to St James Rd Southbound

From 4AM to 9:30AM

  • Bridge St1 between Pitt St and Phillip St Eastbound
  • Bridge St between Phillip St and Young St Westbound
  • Phillip Ln between Phillip St and Bent St
  • Phillip St between Bent St and 16 Phillip St

Notes

1 Managed access between Pitt St and Loftus St for residents and hotel guests only

From 4AM to 11:30AM

  • Bridge St between Phillip St and Conservatorium Rd  
  • Conservatorium Rd between Macquarie St and Government House gates  
  • Kent St1 between Margaret St and Argyle St Northbound
  • Macquarie St between Albert St and Bent St   
  • Phillip Ln between Phillip Ln and Macquarie St   

Notes

1 Managed access between Margaret St and Argyle St for residents and hotel guests only.

From 5AM to 11:30AM

  • Hunter St between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • Macquarie St between Bent St and Hunter St

From 5AM to 12:00PM

  • Art Gallery Rd between Hospital Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd
  • Boomerang Pl between William St and Yurong Pkwy Northbound
  • Hospital Rd1 between Art Gallery Rd and Shakespeare Pl
  • Mrs Macquaries Rd from Art Gallery Rd (full loop)
  • St Marys Rd between Cathedral St and Prince Albert Rd
  • Yurong Pkwy between Boomerang Pl and St Marys Rd Northbound

Notes

1 between 5:00am and 12:00pm a temporary two-way traffic arrangement will be in place for Hospital Rd. Entry and exit will be via Shakespeare Pl only, under traffic control.

From 5:30AM to 11:00AM

  • Bent St1 between Phillip St and Macquarie St
  • Shakespeare Pl between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd

Notes

1 Exit only available from Wilson Parking Chifley Tower Car Park.

CAHILL EXPRESSWAY / SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE

From 4:00AM to 11:30AM

  • Cahill Exp between Conservatorium Rd and Bradfield Hwy (Circular Quay overpass)
  • Cahill Exp From Domain Tunnel on ramp
  • Clarence St slip road between Clarence St and Kent St
  • Kent St on ramp1 between Kent St / Clarence St and Sydney Harbour Bridge

Notes:

1Access to Sydney Harbour Bridge from Sydney CBD is via Clarence St or Harbour St.

DAWES POINT / MILLERS POINT / THE ROCKS / BARANGAROO

From 5:00AM to 11:00AM

  • Argyle Pl between Dalgety Rd and Kent St
  • Argyle St between Kent St and Lower Fort St
  • Bettington St1 between Dalgety Rd and Merriman St
  • Barton St between Barangaroo Ave and Hickson Rd
  • Dalgety Rd between Towns Pl and Argyle Pl
  • Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and George St
  • High Ln1 between Argyle Pl, High St and Kent St
  • High St1 between Argyle Pl and Kent St
  • Jenkins St1 from Gas Ln
  • Merriman St1 from Bettington St
  • Munn St From High St
  • Pottinger St between Hickson Rd and Windmill St
  • Rodens Ln1 from Bettington St
  • Towns Pl between Hickson Rd and Dalgety Rd
  • Upper Fort St between Watson Rd and end
  • Watermans Quay between Barangaroo Ave and Hickson Rd
  • Watson Rd between Upper Fort St and Argyle St
  • Windmill St between Lower Fort St and Dalgety Rd
  • Windmill St between Argyle Pl and Windmill St

Notes

1 Local access available to Kent St as far north as Argyle St.

After 9am, access via High St to Argyle Pl (west of Kent St only), Dalgety Rd, Bettington St, Rodens Ln, Merriman St, and Barangaroo car park. Kent St, south of Argyle St southbound exit allowed for local traffic only.

 

WESTERN DISTRIBUTOR

From 5:00AM to 09:30AM

·       Fig St on ramp to City and Sydney Harbour Bridge

·       King St off ramp to City North and Sydney Harbour Bridge

·       Pyrmont St on ramp to City and Sydney Harbour Bridge

 

Western Distributor eastbound traffic will be diverted to Bathurst St off ramp:

·       Access to Sydney Harbour Bridge is via Harbour St or Clarence St.

·       Access to CBD North is via Kent St or Clarence St

 

SYDNEY CBD / PYRMONT

From 5:00AM to 9:30AM

  • Bunn St between Pyrmont St and Murray St
  • Darling Dr3 between Murray St and Iron Wharf Rd
  • Edward St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Union St
  • Erskine St1 between Kent St and Sussex St Eastbound
  • Erskine St1 between Clarence St and Shelley St Westbound
  • Kent St between Erskine St and Margaret St Northbound
  • King St between Sussex St and Kent St
  • Murray St2 between Pyrmont St and Union St northbound
  • Napoleon St between Hickson Rd and Kent St
  • Pyrmont Bridge Rd between Pyrmont St and Harris St Eastbound
  • Pyrmont Bridge Rd between Pyrmont St and Union St
  • Pyrmont St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Murray St
  • Slip St From Sussex St
  • Sussex St between Napoleon St and King St
  • Union St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Murray St

Notes:

1 between 05:00am and 09:30am:

·       Local access to King St Wharf, Barangaroo South, and Barangaroo Central precincts is via the Western Distributor northbound exit to Wheat Rd, sign-posted ‘Erskine St City North’

·       Restricted exit from King St Wharf and Barangaroo South and Central precincts via Wheat Rd under contra-flow, for vehicles 7m or under in length (21 seat minibuses and smaller)

2 Local access maintained to Murray St south of Union St. NO access to Pyrmont Bridge Rd or Star Casino

3 Local access for residents and Ibis/ Novotel hotels only

PYRMONT

From 5:00AM to 10:00AM

  • Bowman St between Bank St and Cross St
  • Cadigal Ave1 between Bowman St and John St
  • Darling Island Rd From Pirrama Rd
  • Fyfe St between Darling Island Rd and Wharf Cr
  • Harris St1 between Pyrmont Point Park and John St
  • Harvey St between Mount St Walk and Harris St
  • Jones Bay Rd4 between Pyrmont St and Pirrama Rd
  • Jones St1 between Bowman St and John St
  • Mount St Walk between Refinery Dr and Harvey St
  • Pirrama Rd3 between Jones Bay Rd and Harris St
  • Refinery Dr2 between Bowman St and Mount St Walk
  • Tambua St1 between Distillery Dr and Refinery Dr
  • Trouton Pl From Darling Island Dr
  • Wharf Cr between Darling Island Rd (north) and Darling Island Rd (south)

Notes:

1 Exit for local traffic only via John St

2Exit permitted via Refinery Dr to Tambua St before 6:15am subject to police discretion.

3 No access from/to Pirrama Rd from Wharf 7 and Wharf 10 access roads

4 Access maintained for taxis to Star Casino

From 5:00AM to 10:30AM

  • Murray St1 between Union St and Pirrama Rd
  • Pirrama Rd2 between Jones Bay Rd and Murray St

Notes

1 No access to Murray St from the Australian National Maritime Museum access road

2 No access from/to Pirrama Rd from Wharf 7 and Wharf 10 access roads

 

CYCLEWAY CLOSURES

  • College St between Park St and St Marys Rd – 2am to 2pm
  • King St between Phillip St Sth and Macquarie St - 5am to 11:30am
  • No access to Macquarie St from King St Cycleway
  • King St between Kent St and Sussex St – 5am to 9:30am
  • Union St between Edward St and Murray St - 5am to 9:30am

Cyclist detours from 6am-11am Sydney Harbour Bridge: Cycling detours will be in place between Kent St cycleway and the Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway, via Observatory Hill. Marshals will be on site to direct cyclists across Upper Fort St in both directions when safe gaps between runners are available. Alternatively, cyclists can travel between Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway and Sydney CBD via Cumberland St.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

From 12 Midnight to 2PM

  • College St between Prince Albert Rd and Park St Eastern side

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Circular Quay

  • Access will be managed under traffic control to properties on Albert St, Macquarie St (North of Albert St) and Phillip Lane throughout the closures for local residents/hotel guests only. Entry via Bridge St and Loftus St. Exit via Young St and Bridge St
  • Access for local residents and hotel guests on Pitt St only will be maintained via Bridge St eastbound and Loftus St.

Sydney Hospital & Hospital Rd

  • From 5am to 12pm: Two-way access to Hospital Rd via Shakespeare Place only under traffic control. No access from St Marys Rd

King St Wharf and Barangaroo South

  • Access to and from King St Wharf, Cockle Bay Wharf and Barangaroo will be restricted to tenants/residents only and managed via Wheat Rd under traffic control between 6am and 9.30am. No access via Erskine St or Sussex St.
  • Entry: via Harbour St continue Western Distributor northbound veer left into Wheat Rd at the signposted exit for Erskine St / CBD North
  • Exit: Light vehicles will be able to exit the precinct via Wheat Rd southbound under two-way traffic control. Vehicles over 7 metres (including trucks, buses and coaches) will be unable to use the managed exit and will need to remain within the precinct until Erskine St reopens at 9.30am.
  • Before and after these times access is maintained via Erskine St at Kent St. We strongly advise motorists to avoid non-essential travel to or from these precincts between 6am and 9.30am as delays are expected.

Millers Point & Barangaroo North

  • Managed access for Kent St properties as far north as Argyle St and High St will be maintained by traffic control at the Margaret St intersection for the duration of the event. Kent St southbound exit allowed for local traffic only.
  • From 9am to 11am only, access to Barangaroo Reserve & car park, Dalgety Rd and Bettington St will be available, entry via Kent St, High St, Argyle Pl, and Dalgety Rd.

The Rocks & Dawes Point local access:

  • Maintained via Lang St & Harrington St throughout the event.

Pyrmont

  • Murray St properties between Union St and Pyrmont St, and Wilson Parking 100 Murray St:
  • between 5am and 9.30am access to and from properties/hotels on Murray St and surrounding local roads will be permitted under traffic control via Darling Drive for light vehicles and coaches only (trucks not permitted). Note, coaches can only turn around via hotel driveways.
  • The Star: between 5am and 9.30am access to and from The Star car park is via Pyrmont St only
  • Refinery Dr: Refinery Dr will be closed from 5am to 10am with exit permitted via Tambua St before 6:15am and after 9:15am only at Police discretion when there are safe gaps between runners. If you need access to your vehicle/property during these times, please plan ahead and relocate your vehicle prior.
  • Pyrmont St properties between Bunn St and Murray St: exit from driveways permitted throughout event under traffic control.
  • Wharf 7 and 10: From 5am to 10.30am, no access from/to Pirrama Rd from Wharf 7 and Wharf 10 access roads
arrangementElements.title: Managed local access arrangements

properties.diversions: Buses in the city and Pyrmont will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

roads.mainStreet: Cahill Expressway, Western Distributor, Macquarie Street, Hickson Road

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will also run towards Manly and Mona Vale after the game to help you get home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Raiders at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. NRL kick-off at 6pm, full time around 7.40pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to the stadium during the already busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pittwater Road

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 may be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed outside the stadium. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip

arrangementAttachments.displayName: CommBank Stadium event road closures and bus changes map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: CommBank Stadium event road closures and bus changes map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: CommBank Stadium event road closures and bus changes map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Broncos at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 8pm and full time 9:45pm.

Large crowds are expected and traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta during the already busy Friday evening peak. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close after the game to allow crowds to safely leave the precinct. Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. Fans travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Bulldogs at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off at 6pm, full time approx. 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as thousands of fans travel to the stadium in the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Mulgoa Road, Jamison Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Rabbitohs at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Preliminary games at 12:40pm and 3pm. NRL kick-off at 5:30pm, full time around 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of match start including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.publicTransport: ﻿Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Anirudh Hukum concert will be taking place at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday 11 May from 7pm until 10:30pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
The Lake Mac Autumn Fair will be held on Saturday 4th May at Speers Point Park from 8:30am to 4pm.

Traffic control will be in place at the pedestrian crossing for the safety of event attendees.

There will be increased traffic at The Esplanade and Five Islands Road Follow as attendees travel to and from the event. Please follow the direction of traffic controllers and signage in place.

roads.mainStreet: Five Islands Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets for both matches. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v GWS Giants at the SCG. First bounce 1:45pm, finish at 4:30pm.

A-League Semi Final: Sydney FC v Macarthur at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm, full-time approx 9:30pm.

With thousands of fans expected to attend both events traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the matches throughout the afternoon and evening. Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the games as delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 10:45am and will reopen after the A-League Semi Final. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. EP2 will only be open for the AFL.
  • Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas between 11am and 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Oxford St, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator

properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Brumbies at Allianz Stadium.Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.10pm. Wallaroos will play Canada at 4:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads around Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 4:30pm). EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 10pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Warriors at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 2pm, full time around 4pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the game.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12pm midday and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 and EP3 grass car parks and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 11am).

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am until 6pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Adelaide United at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off at 7pm finish around 8.50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game during Wednesday evening peak.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 5pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Dane Drive
